meanings.definition: The system by which coats of arms and other armorial bearings are devised, described, and regulated.
meanings.sent1: In medieval times, families used heraldries to show their unique symbols on shields.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed various heraldries representing different noble families.
meanings.sent3: The knight's heraldries were so intricate that they seemed like secret codes.
meanings.sent4: Heraldries in ancient times were like colorful stories painted on shields.
meanings.sent5: The heraldries of the kingdom were proudly displayed during the royal procession.

meanings.definition: The practice of devising, granting, and blazoning armorial bearings.
meanings.sent1: The heraldries of the knights were carefully designed to represent their bravery.
meanings.sent2: Artists specialized in creating unique heraldries for noble families.
meanings.sent3: The heraldries of the kingdom were so popular that everyone wanted one.
meanings.sent4: The heraldries of old were like beautiful paintings that told stories of valor.
meanings.sent5: The heraldries of the castle were a source of pride for all its inhabitants.

meanings.definition: The study of coats of arms and the history of heraldic symbols.
meanings.sent1: Scholars dedicated their lives to unraveling the mysteries of heraldries.
meanings.sent2: The library contained many books on the subject of heraldries and their meanings.
meanings.sent3: The students found the study of heraldries surprisingly fascinating.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the world of heraldries was like diving into a colorful history book.
meanings.sent5: The professor's knowledge of heraldries was unmatched in the academic world.
